description: From eco- +‎ system. Coined by English botanist Arthur Tansley in 1935 in a paper titled "The Use and Abuse of Vegetational Concepts" in the journal Ecology.

entries.meaning: A system formed by an ecological community and its environment that functions as a unit.
The interconnectedness of organisms (plants, animals, microbes) with each other and their environment.
(by extension) A network of interconnected people or organisations that resembles a natural ecosystem due to the complex interdependencies.
examples: The company’s ecosystem mainly comprises its supply chain, customers, end consumers and competitors.
